etymologies: Middle English sclate, sklate, shortening of Old French esclate, feminine synonymous with esclat ‘piece broken off’ (see slat)

definitions: a fine-grained gray, green, or bluish metamorphic rock easily split into smooth, flat pieces
shortDefinitions: fine-grained grey, green, or bluish-purple metamorphic rock easily split into smooth, flat plates

definitions: a flat piece of slate used as roofing material

examples.text: a loose slate falls from the roof

shortDefinitions: flat plate of slate used as roofing material

definitions: a flat piece of slate used for writing on, typically framed in wood, formerly used in schools

examples.text: the teacher was demonstrating, the children copying onto slates

shortDefinitions: flat plate of slate formerly used for writing on in schools

definitions: a small portable computer that accepts input directly on to its screen rather than via a keyboard or mouse; a tablet computer

examples.text: after getting our hands on one this afternoon, we found that it’s a solid, well-performing slate that’s easy on the eyes

shortDefinitions: small portable computer that accepts input directly on to screen rather than via keyboard or mouse

definitions: a list of candidates for election to a post or office, typically a group sharing a set of political views

examples.text: another slate of candidates will be picked for the state convention

shortDefinitions: list of candidates for election to post or office

examples.text: the company has revealed details of a $60 million slate of film productions

definitions: a board showing the identifying details of a take of a motion picture, which is held in front of the camera at its beginning and end

examples.text: the electronic time-code system allowed us to shoot with or without conventional slates

shortDefinitions: board showing identifying details of take in film, held in front of camera at beginning and end of take

definitions: cover (something, especially a roof) with slates

examples.text: he was working for his father slating a new roof
his work was slated by the critics
renovations are slated for late June
construction is slated to begin late next year

definitions: nominate (someone) as a candidate for an office or post

examples.text: I understand that I am being slated for promotion

shortDefinitions: nominate someone as candidate for office or post

definitions: identify (a movie take) using a slate

examples.text: the assistant cameraman is about to slate the scene

shortDefinitions: identify take in film using slate
